definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Image CreditWhen reduced to begging in enclaves of humanity, the birds can often lose some of the wildness.
sentences.chinese: 在人类居住地乞食的鹤鸵渐渐的就会失去野性。

sentences.english: Since being residentially different, title is also each and not identical.
sentences.chinese: 由于居住地不同，称谓也各不相同。

sentences.english: The place you choose could determine that.
sentences.chinese: 你所选择的居住地点将会决定这些。

sentences.english: RECIFE is one of the oldest settlements in Brazil, dating from 1535.
sentences.chinese: 是巴西最古老的居住地之一，始建于1535年。

sentences.english: We'reWe'll also have to think about restoring some of our habitats like mangroves and coral reefs.
sentences.chinese: 我们还需要考虑恢复一些居住地，像红树林和珊瑚礁。

sentences.english: Have you looked at the self-help section of your local book store?
sentences.chinese: 去过你居住地书店的自己取阅柜吧？

sentences.english: They get their name from their home -- the Kalahari Desert.
sentences.chinese: 它们因其居住地卡拉哈里沙漠得名。

sentences.english: Herdsmen and herdswomen are building tents with domed roofs in the site of their new home.
sentences.chinese: 牧民们正在这个新的居住地搭建穹庐呢。

sentences.english: These tools were found in an early Iron Age settlement.
sentences.chinese: 这些工具是在一个铁器时代初期的一个居住地发现的。

sentences.english: We met with defectors away from their actual places of work or residence.
sentences.chinese: 我们采访了从工作地或者是居住地逃跑的人们。

sentences.english: Us. We destroyed that habitat of bees for our needs.
sentences.chinese: 我们为了自己的需要毁坏蜜蜂的居住地。

sentences.english: Locations of branches and customer residences can be described with points.
sentences.chinese: 分公司和客户居住地的位置可以用点描述。

sentences.english: It's not the best place to live anymore.
sentences.chinese: 这不再是最理想的居住地了。

sentences.english: The Winter Palace in St Petersburg was a house for the Tsar of Russia.
sentences.chinese: 位于圣彼得堡的冬宫曾是俄国沙皇的居住地。

sentences.english: Hokkaido is one of the residences of A'YiNu people.
sentences.chinese: 北海道是阿伊努民族的居住地之一。

sentences.english: We destroyed that habitat of bees for our needs.
sentences.chinese: 我们为了自己的需要毁坏蜜蜂的居住地。

definition: to reside/to dwell/to live in a place/resident in
long-term resident/permanent residence/eternalism (permanence of soul, Sanskrit śāśvata-vāda)
